_header: On cliff that castle so knettered
_description: An alliterative poem (with some phrases from Sir Gawain and the Green Knight) describing a castle, the approach of summer, and love-making, perhaps by Humfrey Newton — 53 alliterative lines in rhyming quatrains

BodLatMisC66.First Lines:
On clife þat castell so kneteredas cloude vmbe knagged &
                    knatered…
BodLatMisC66.Last Lines:
…And iche man myngesto medel his make toAnd to teche hir
                    þat cannot for to tak to
